intro: Acontias variegatus, commonly known as the variegated acontia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with variegated patterns of green and white. The plant produces small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Acontias variegatus prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it adaptable to a variety of garden settings.
